# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` that takes a string and wraps it according to a specified `text_width`:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_lines = String[] # Array to hold the resulting lines
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= (isempty(current_line) ? "" : " ") * word
        end
    end

    push!(wrapped_lines, current_line) # Add the last line
    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is an example of the string wrapping in Julia!"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
This is an
example of
the string
wrapping in
Julia!
``` 

You can adjust the `text_width` parameter to change the maximum line length.
